meanings.definition: Remove the flesh and organs from (a body or object) to reveal the skeleton.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist was carefully skeletonizing the ancient remains.
meanings.sent2: After the scavengers had finished skeletonizing the carcass, only bones remained.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that he was skeletonizing the chicken to make a spooky Halloween dish.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to skeletonize the canvas, leaving only the essence of the scene.
meanings.sent5: The process of skeletonizing the fish made the biology lesson more interesting.

meanings.definition: To strip or reduce something to its bare essentials or framework.
meanings.sent1: The editor was skeletonizing the lengthy manuscript to meet the word limit.
meanings.sent2: The designer decided to skeletonize the complex design to make it more user-friendly.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he would skeletonize his jokes to get straight to the punchline.
meanings.sent4: The economic crisis seemed to skeletonize the company, leaving only the core operations.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a diagram to skeletonize the concept for easier understanding.
